rationale: UC-1 and UC-14 describe modernized product delivery via app/machine; UC-2, UC-5 and UC-24 cover updated management features; UC-7 covers maintenance aspects, collectively modernizing management and delivery.

Authentication/registration (UC-3, UC-10), admin dashboards and management (UC-2, UC-5, UC-24), maintenance (UC-7) and client-machine communication tracking (UC-34) provide an integrated platform; security is addressed through login flows.
UC-1 explicitly describes scanning the QR and completing payment; UC-13 (connect to vending machine) and UC-14 (buy item) cover the connection and purchase steps that implement this requirement.
UC-2 Admin Dashboard Monitoring and analytics use cases (UC-19, UC-32) explicitly show dashboards with sales and malfunction statistics.
UC-2 and UC-5 provide monitoring of sales and stock and planning features; analytics (UC-19/UC-32) and maintenance tasks (UC-7) support efficient planning and monitoring.
User-focused flows (purchase UC-1/UC-14, registration UC-3, wallet recharge UC-4/UC-15) implement features that improve user experience.
Maintenance and task management use cases (UC-7, UC-16-18, UC-22, UC-23) enable faster operator response through automated reports and task workflows.
No use case explicitly addresses scalability or alignment with modern technologies (architecture/non-functional aspects) in the provided set.

Admin dashboard and analytics (UC-2, UC-32) show stock monitoring; purchase flow (UC-14) checks availability; maintenance (UC-7) reacts to stock data, together supporting real-time inventory tracking.
Digital payments are implemented in purchase flows (UC-1, UC-30) and wallet recharge flows including online methods (UC-4, UC-15).
Admin management and CRUD use cases (UC-5, UC-6, UC-20, UC-21) plus dashboard monitoring (UC-2) provide centralized management and maintenance tools.

Digital payments are covered by purchase/recharge UCs (UC-1, UC-4); remote monitoring is covered by dashboard and connection tracking (UC-2, UC-19, UC-34), fulfilling integration of payments and monitoring.
UC-3 and UC-10 cover registration/login; UC-28 and UC-29 cover viewing wallet balance and transaction history after authentication.
Wallet recharge in cash at machine and online methods are described in UC-4 and UC-15.
Purchase flows (UC-1 and UC-14) describe checking balance and automatically deducting the purchase amount from the wallet.
Admin Management (UC-5), dashboard/analytics (UC-2, UC-19) and vending machine creation (UC-24) provide configuration, price management and reporting capabilities.
CRUD operations for users, machines and items are implemented in UC-6 and the specific management use cases (UC-20, UC-21) and creation flow UC-24.
UC-7 describes maintenance driven by automatic reports; worker task views and completion (UC-16-18) and task assignment (UC-22) implement automatic reporting and consequent actions.
UC-34 tracks active connections enabling detection of disconnected machines; monitoring dashboards (UC-2, UC-19) expose connection status for detection.
No use case explicitly describes an offline register for locally tracking transactions during disconnection.
No use case describes synchronization of locally stored transactions with the central database upon reconnection.
There is no explicit use case for anonymous users completing cash-only transactions without registration.
Provisioning infrastructure (modems, servers) is a deployment/constraint requirement not covered by any use case.
User authentication and access to a personalized interface are implemented by the login and registration use cases (UC-10, UC-3).
UC-10 explicitly states that the system verifies credentials during login.
UC-10 alternative flows include an error message for incorrect credentials, matching this requirement.
UC-3 covers user registration flows; while fields are not enumerated in the use case text, the registration use case implements the account creation requirement.
No use case explicitly describes validation of registration fields during user sign-up.
UC-24 explicitly describes the admin creating a new vending machine.
UC-24 includes the step where the system saves the new vending machine in the database.
UC-24 explicitly includes verification of the data provided when creating a vending machine.
UC-24 alternative flows include error messages and retry behavior on save errors.
UC-13 (connect to vending machine) and UC-34 (track active connections) implement communication support between clients and machines.
UC-34 specifically tracks active connections including user_id, machine_id and start time, directly satisfying the requirement.
UC-13 connects a user to a specific vending machine and UC-34 tracks those concrete user-machine connections.
UC-35 outlines remote maintenance features (e.g., unlocking a stuck product) intended for future development, directly mapping to this goal.
